alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 3:08AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Stream, normally dry wash, and slot canyon flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring within Zion National Park. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following counties, Iron, Kane and Washington. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. While flows are beginning to decrease tonight, they remain quite elevated. Flows are expected to diminish into Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 306 AM MDT, Gauges continue to report very high flows across area streams and river. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Creek, Ash Creek, North Fork Virgin River, Kolob Creek, Dry Creek, Currant Creek, La Verkin Creek, Little Creek, Virgin River, Right Fork North Creek, Taylor Creek, Clear Creek, Shunes Creek, Blue Creek, East Fork Virgin River, Timber Creek and Locust Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Zion National Park, Springdale, Rockville and Kolob Canyon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
